intro: Stackhousia linarioides, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow, typically blooming from spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
